google_play_reviews.content: I used it for my research and felt it's easy to use and very handy. But I'm facing one problem. When I exported the data in a txt file, the timestamp is in global time instead of my local time despite turning on the option for showing the time in the local timezone. Any suggestions on how to tackle this problem would be really helpful. Thanks
google_play_reviews.replyContent: All the timestamps are always exported in UTC, as required by KML and GPX standards. The local time is used only for visualization purpose and to name the files, for user convenience. In TXT files you can easily shift the timestamps using a spreadsheet.

google_play_reviews.content: I have recorded 741 tracks very successfully. I think this App is exceptional. Not one failure. Recommended for people who want to record trips with excellent opportunities to name the track.
Export / save to Google Drive
Not working for me
Simple to use.
Love it. Thnku

Great app that simply works. However, one thing that irrirates is that the "Stabilising signal" message appears right on top of the 3 dot options menu. Why can't the message appear in a less obstructive location?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The "Stabilising signal" message should appear in the same place of the "Searching for GPS" one immediately before the first valid position. If it appears in a wrong position please send us a email with a screenshot, and we'll fix it. If you have a proposal to improve the stabilisation phase please open an issue in GitHub or send us it via email.

google_play_reviews.content: Best
Very good
Nice app
Not only is the app excellent, but dev support in the reviews is also great.
Used it for my civil engineering study, worked great üëç

It simply logs your tracks, allowing for inserting manual waypoints. Adjustable recording frequency. Can quickly display completed track in e.g. Google Earth. Well done. I wish the display precision of Lat/Long coordinates were adjustable. As it is, it displays 9 decimal places which roughly corresponds to the location accuracy of some 0.1 mm! Given that CEP of most phone GPS is likely a few meters, displaying five decimal places (1 m) or even 4 (10 m) seems more practical and truthful.

Version 2.2.6 does not work on my OnePlus 5T, oxygen 9.11. App gives "killed in background" message. Turned off battery optimisation for the app and restarted... NoJoy. Battery saver is also disabled. After some research I found that Oukitel have tweeked OS to kill background apps after an hour irrespective of "don't optimise" setting. Hence the app is good, and my Oukitel OS is bugged.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for choosing to share your experience with other users!

google_play_reviews.content: So far so good. Lightweight, doesn't consume too much battery power even if running for hours in the background and recording a long motorbike tour, I can leave home with even a 60-70% battery charge and that's enough for the whole day! Though I would love a feature if it could record other telemetry data as well, if it could be configurable. For example gyro, so acceleration for every directions could be fetched from the gpx stream.
Reliable..

used it frequently. initially, I lost some tracks, but the option to "lock" the phone once tracking solved that problem. The App is brilliant, small though complete functionality for tracking. Thanks guys.
No-nonsense private tracker app.

This is a fantastic app. I use it every day for my ecological fieldwork. Efficient, user friendly and no nonsense. Makes me feel proud to be a human to know that other people have created this to make my research life easy, and have given it freely. Many thanks.
For me its the best track logger. Simple, fast, lightweight.
Does a great job at recording trips in the background. Runs in low power mode. Has all the features I require from a passive GPS tracking app and easily exports the recording.
Works perfectly, exactly as described. Read the documentation before you post a complaint.
Great app...thank you.
Quality and GPL, what more could you ask for?

Very easy to use. And acurate. Nice bonus is the save/mark of waypoints and i love the easy export of .gpx (direct open i Garmin basecamp and many other pc software) and kml file to open it in 'Google earth'. Thanks a lot to all the programmers. MariusS.
Fantastic. I use this to log GPX data to upload 360 videos to Street View. Records position every second, works great!
Ok
As a zero cost GPS recording device, I find this software to be excellent.
It's great
Very good app for gps & latitude

Tried to upload GTX to Google street studio and it resulted in an error "GPS data contains gaps greater than 5 seconds in between GPS points. 17sec gap found after 4 seconds. Does anyone know what exactly is this means and how to rectify it?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Google Street Studio requires to have 1 point every 5 seconds (or less) in your GPX. You should record the track with a GPS Update Interval of 1 second and without interval and distance filters, in order to have 1 point every second. If the settings are already correct maybe it could be a momentary loss of GPS signal.

google_play_reviews.content: If only it were accurate on distance. Prev versions had no issues, tracked matched odometer. Last few times, its like the tracked distance is only 75% of the actual distance ridden. Odometer is 3.6 miles but app only shows 4.74km / 2.9 miles. Please fix.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We didn't make changes on distance calculation on the last few releases, but maybe the problem is older. We'll check the code to find any possible bug. In the meantime please test if the issue is present also recording a straight line, and check also if your tracks with wrong distance are complete: the device could lose the GPS signal for some time

google_play_reviews.content: It is easy to use when it's working and is pretty responsive. Just see from time to time if the app is still running, a few times my track stopped after a few hours. I use the output files with ( exiftool ) to tag photos from my Nikon DSLR and mirrorless Fujifilm cameras that don't embed gps information.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The recording might be stopped by the system when the app was in background. Please try to go on Android Settings, Apps, GPS Logger, Battery and verify that the Background Activity is allowed and the Battery Usage is Not Optimised. Or it could be only a momentary problem of the GPS signal...

google_play_reviews.content: Super
Works well. Thanks. Unfortunately i inherited an iphone so i will have to find something else
Excellent app, easy to use and simple to extract data.
I have been looking for an app like this for ages! I work as a botanical surveyor and to be able to map a habitat by walking around it and loading the route to Google earth is a dream! Thank you üòä
Actually 4.6
Fantastic just what I have been looking for. Well done and many thanks
Keep clean and clear tracking info
The logic behind the car/bike/run recording type is flawed. It takes only the max. speed into account and sets at at 50km/h for bike/car.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: In general an activity recognition algorithm cannot be exact and 100% scientific, however ours shows to have great room for improvement :). Anyway, GPS Logger is open source software: anyone can go on https://github.com/BasicAirData/GPSLogger and propose a better evaluation logic. Any suggestion is really appreciated!

google_play_reviews.content: Simple, direct, useful GPS data logger. Exactly what I wanted, and nothing I don't want. Thank you very much for doing this app.
Absolutely what I have been looking for since forever. Very lightweight, intuitive and most importantly STABLE. Brilliant design.
Love this app. Hands down the best GPS tracker app I have found. I use it mainly for GPS tagging photos and it works perfectly. Thank you so much for this.
Easy to use, efficient. Keep the good work guys.
Excellent! and accurate

Simple and good. But be aware that it crashes silently quite often, leaving you with hours of empty tracks that should have been recorded. So if you need your track recording absolutely, make sure you don't forget to check the status of application constantly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Try to exclude the app from battery optimizations. Usually the setting is on Android Settings, Apps, GPS Logger, Battery, Battery optimization, All apps, GPS Logger, Don‚Äôt optimize. You should also set your system battery saving in Performance mode (disable all power savings)

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful to geotag photos afterwards.
Works great especially for free

This best app I use so far. It does exactly what it should do. It's perfect for anyone just needs to record GPS data and track you where you go (walking, running, driving, etc. I would like to use this app on iPhones!!! Please make one for iPhone too. Thank you!!! Keep it up.

Simple but competent GPS logger. Doesn't cost too much battery. Very simple to use. It has 2 functions, record track and save waypoints. It doesn't have map, so you would need to export the tracks to other apps to view it. The app will detect biking, walking & driving and can export tracks to default locations. The only feature it missed is I hope it allow renaming of the tracks. Edit: It has rename function now, I want to give this review six stars, too bad it only allow me to set five stars.

Very basic but just what I need of logging locations and tracks to be exported for use with GIS applications. Accuracy is decent, no need to buy a dedicated consumer grade GPS device. No ads, very great. An offline map would be a great addition, but until then, just 4 stars for the moment.
Good for me
Great app use to tag photos
After restart of phone app stop to continue with logging??
Reliable, never crashes, does what it says. I love it. Great job, developers!
Fantastic app, does its job well, doesn't try to do everything else. I can confirm altitude is very accurate, I found it agreed to within a metre with altitudes marked on infrastructure in the Alps.

Very valuable app! May I suggest a new feature? The "Annotate" function to store a coordinate only grabs the coordinate found in the last gps reading (often inaccurate), but it would be nice to get an "Average" coordinate: similar to what a surveyor would do, start gathering multiple coordinates, while the user lets it run in a fixed location as long as they need, and when finished it stores the average of all those gathered points.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It seems a good feature to implement. Gps Logger is a free and opensource app: we opened the issue with the feature request in GitHub (https://github.com/BasicAirData/GPSLogger/issues/189), where we collect ideas, mockups, proposals and we track a possible implementation. Thanks for your suggestion!

google_play_reviews.content: Its awesome app and very helpful. Is there any way this app can have feature like: 1)selecting all tracklist and merge them into 1 and have a single file with all data with total distance driven and total time. 2) No option to select all tracks in tracklist.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: 1) Unfortunately we have not in plan to implement the feature, but maybe you can find some online services that can fit your needs. 2) You can (de)select a range of tracks by (de)selecting the first and then long-clicking on the last one of the range.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and functional, but I have a couple of issues: it bothers me that it saves my files in a new folder inside the folder that I specified. Also I mostly use it on boats and there's no option to specify that it's on a boat at sea, so I have to allocate a category that doesn't make any sense, like walking or driving.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v3.2.0 introduced a new activity selector with a larger number of icons. Boat included!

google_play_reviews.content: Nice app
Just great!
I have been using GPS Logger more so than my Garmin, works great with Base Camp.
Just perfect within seconds you have your track sent by E-mail with Google Earth KML file attached. Great App. Thank you.
Great app. Using it to create tracks and then in Lightroom tag photos. Everything works perfectly. Although MIUI sometimes kills app. Butt Logger resume track when gps connected again.
Awesome app
It's simple to use, fast, efficient, and it works! Awesomeness in an app! Keep up the good work!

Works great, thank you. One request would be to create waypoints with a one touch button and automatically label them based on time. I often pass by points of interest and need a quick way to add a waypoint while the logging is running
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can add a waypoint in a quick way (without showing the dialog) with a long click of the Annotation button. The waypoint you create has an empty description, but the timestamp of each annotation is already saved, and exported in GPX and TXT files.

google_play_reviews.content: Lacking position formats. In particular British National Grid.
Simple but clean from ads. Has almost all the minimum necessary functions and works properly.
Top notch. Works flawlessly. No ads.
An excellent simple to use app.

I've only had this for a day, but so far it's been awesome! Started tracking when I hit the first dirt road today, quickly added "annotations" at places with good camp sites, deadfalls, views, washouts, etc., and was able to quickly export the data when I got home. Pulled the gpx up in gpx studio and clipped some of the data out (I'd forgotten to stop tracking), then exported that and uploaded into a Google Map. So, so easy and simple. I've never done anything like this before. Thank you!
Excellent basic tracker

As an application developer myself, I could tell right away that a lot of thought has been put into GPS Logger. It looks great and works great. And appearance is very important, as it can (and here does) enhance usability and intuitiveness. Very professional.

if i am heading from point A to point B, start time id 10.00, end of the trip is 12.00... how to check with the help of this app, where i was at 10.15 or 10.25 or 11.19 with very very accurate location... so far, i was able to see the route, from point A to B .. but i was not able to see where I was at specific time ...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app has been made with the purpose of recording and exporting tracks, thus has NO integrated maps. If you want to see and analyse them you should install a good GPX viewer. If you install it, you should be able to open the tracks with it directly from the GPS Logger tracklist, using the "View" feature.

google_play_reviews.content: It simply works! Gave it to someone who've never seen it to log critical waypoints and working with it was intuitive.
Lean and nice!
Excellent app. Does what I need, and exports to GPX, KML and TXT (CSV) formats for easy processing on a computer.

Excellent app, does exactly what I wanted it to do! It's also very useful if you want increased location accuracy in other apps, just record while using the apps and the it'll have really good accuracy!
Excellent. Exactly what I was looking for. Thanks to developers.
Very basic and that's what I like. Loaded it, tried it, and it workedüëç Wish I could use it with a Bluetooth or USB external GPS but oh well...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: In case you need help to use GPS Logger with a Bluetooth external GPS receiver, you could read this short guide: https://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/application-note-gpslogger/using-a-bluetooth-gps-receiver-with-gps-logger/

google_play_reviews.content: While logging, I want to be able to lock the screen and put the phone in my pocket or use a navigation app in the foreground. Either or both is suspending the GPS Logger app. I have Android 10. I found that I can give the app GPS access permission for when it is in use only not all the time. Thanks for your prompt reply. Had checked those beforehand. So, app is not battery optimized and battery saver is off. According another feedback, the cause is with MIUI of my Xiaomi phone being aggressive.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Your issue is related to Android background restrictions, and not to permission problem. To let an app working in background go to Android settings & turn off all battery optimizations for the app. Furthermore you should turn off the battery saver. I found this link that maybe can help you: https://dontkillmyapp.com/xiaomi

google_play_reviews.content: I really want to like this app but it just doesn't work with my Huawei phone. The last time, I took particular care to ensure that battery optimisation was disabled for the app, set it to record at the start of my 45 min journey and it only recorded the first 2 minutes. I've tried 4 times now on various journeys - it loses my location some time during the journey and doesn't get it back. Such a shame. EDIT - tried again, no joy-only records first 2mins. Given up on it. Sorry, developer.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We already have very good feedback from people that are using the app on Honor 10 lite. You could start reading our F.A.Q. page (https://github.com/BasicAirData/GPSLogger#frequently-asked-questions) where you'll find some tips on this topic. As note, I report that a user had a similar problem and resolved with a re-installation of the app.

google_play_reviews.content: Yea good go for me

What an excellent app that gets better and better: it's easy to use and battery-friendly. [Edited:] Is there any chance of combining the GPS Fix and Track screens into one? Or duplicating the GPS Accuracy and Altitude on the Track screen? I like to keep an eye on the Accuracy as I track, so currently have to keep switching between the two screens.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: To date there is no way to mix GPS FIX and TRACK tabs into one and currently we have no plans to implement it. But GPS Logger is an open source project: we opened a GitHub issue with your feature request (https://github.com/BasicAirData/GPSLogger/issues/175), hoping it will be implemented by some developer in the future. Thanks for your suggestion!

google_play_reviews.content: Does one thing and one thing well
Usefull app
best
This app is simple to use, but make sure power saving is off, otherwise it I'll not log your location when the screen is off

Hi, looks like a great app and love that it is open source. I am unable to connect to any satellites. Using a Pixel 3a, I have tried restarting my phone as mentioned in several comments, followed the getting started guide, and opening the app in an open space. But the GPS fix tab always just says: "Looking for GPS 0/##". The ## is updating so the app does seem to be doing some searching, but the first number is always 0 satellites.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The device should be fully compatible with the app, we already have some very positive feedback from users that use the app on Pixel 3a. Please try to uninstall the app and reinstall it: someone reported that a new installation solved the problem. If you like, we would be glad to receive a feedback of it.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app for tracking excursions. Needs a paddling category though.
good apps .
Very useful.
Does a great job, easily the best GPS tracker I have used.
Simple, Easy, Clear, Well explained, Intuitive.
Minggus Dakaraye

Nice program ... I'm playing with Static DGPS(... Stop and Go Kinematic), with old cell phones ... My "MOTO's", log properly. My "TCL", not so ... Lats & Long & elev begin repeating after the 4th epoch, then 35 minutes of no change) ... Don't know if it's only the phone or the program & the phone "Wandering", DELTA LAT/LON/ELEV changing, should be almost exactly the same relation as long as the phones are within a few miles of one another and see the same sats ... I'm hoping for precision of maybe a few inches ... RINEX would be really nice ...
I like the app, I would suggest to add an auto start of the tracking either by opening the app or when connected to a Bluetooth device.

Works great in the field, but I had trouble moving the coordinates to Google Earth Pro back at home. Each .kmz file was created with zero bytes of data, yet I could still see the data in GPS Logger. Ended up having to eyeball two screens at once to transfer coordinates manually.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: How do you transfer the KML files to your PC? Please be more specific, and we'll try to solve your issue.

google_play_reviews.content: High
Used for the first time today Seems ok, but was not able to export the file to my pc. I am now able to save the file by either email or uploading it to Google Drive.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There are several ways to export a track to the PC (with a USB cable, via Dropbox, Google Drive, FTP, E-mail, ...). Please be more specific to describe your problem (you can also use the support email), and we'll be glad to help you!

google_play_reviews.content: Best GPS logger. Reliable and precise. Great app design. You just have nothing further to ask of this.
Good App
üëç
Very useful, accurate, phone friendly and stable. A1 app
Really good
Just installed the app. I don't see an option to send the data to a server. Manually or on time intervals ( or a schedule ).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app records your tracks into a local database and export / share them in KML, GPX and TXT format. Using the Share feature you can send your tracks to Dropbox, Google Drive, FTP, email and in many other ways depending on the apps installed on your device. GPS Logger doesn't send data to any server.

google_play_reviews.content: Works like a charm, would be even better with WearOS support :)
Does what it says on the can!
Perfect app for recording my faunal surveys in a file type I can open in Google Earth. Low battery use, simple to use and accurate.
A great app
I used this app just for fun to track where I was going and my walking history and the app is just like what it's described. It's nice and easy to use overall. Very nice!

Does exactly what I need. Perfection would be to add an option of continuing to log trackpoints with the last known coordinates upon losing satellite fix. This would help tremendously when geotagging photos from my dSLR, when moving from shooting outside to inside with no reception.
I used this a year ago. Then I was using it just now, and it seems to have not gotten any more fancy, and still works a charm. Perhaps even smoothed out a few tiny issues!
Nice, good features, easy to use
No Ads. Simple and does what it dies well.
Works very well. Hope to use next in my projects
Accurate, but once in a while it will delete all your files. Surprise!
Solid performing app. Nothing fancy, but dependable.
works great and I export to kml to add tracks to PC map program (Surfer).
Perfect for recording track. Easy to export to other apps.
good
Tracks location, shows coordinates, elevation, direction, count of visible satellites; no ads, no in-app purchases; simple, clean, perfect!

Exactly what I need: gives you all the raw data in CSV including speed and altitude. Importing its exported KML into Google Earth was seamless. Just one idea: the frequency options are pretty extreme at 1s, 2s or 3s. If I'm recording an all-day hike, this is overkill. I'd choose 30s if there was nothing smarter like "record as few points as possible as long as the interpolation is never wrong by more than X meters horizontally, Y meters vertically, or T seconds.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v3.1 implemented two filters that work as you described. The purpose of them is not to save battery (because the GPS must stay ON to obtain a good accuracy), but to limit the amount of trackpoints recorded.

google_play_reviews.content: I use this to track my metal detecting adventures and it works great
Nice app.
App is very instrumental capturing property violations.
Good app. It does what it says and the interface is simple and clean. However there is an important drawback: the timer will not pause even if you select to pause the logger.
Does exactly what it says on the tin.
Only two applications on the Play Store are able to record without interruption for long distances (GPS Logger) and (OSMTracker for Android‚Ñ¢) üëâüëâüëâ Allow app in ignore battery optimizations

A good app for logging gps data, couldn't figure out how to export timestamp data along with location in Kml format, but developers guided to use gpx format and was able to get it. Thanks again, keep up the good work.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The times are not included into KML files because unfortunately the KML standard doesn't support timestamps. If you want timestamps you should export data in GPX or TXT.

google_play_reviews.content: This is an excellent app for a lot of technical data collected. It contained more than what I was looking for, and when I wanted to find out how I could extract information, I discovered this was open-source GPL software, enabling me not to re-invent the wheel for some extra feature.

Okay for me, but when my screen goes off the gps is lost and says stabilizing connect
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The GPS should stay ON also in background when the app is recording. If not, you should check if there is some optimization active and, in case, turn it OFF. You should also set the power saving mode to maximum performance, because some brands tend to be aggressive with the GPS in background when the power Saving is active.

google_play_reviews.content: Does what it says on the tin with no ads!

Great app! I downloaded this halfway through a hike to get some basic distance calculations and gpx tracks and it worked perfectly. Bonus points for being comparatively small and lightweight (3 hours of hiking only drained my battery about 24% and my phone normally drains much faster especially with GPS on) I know hiking isn't the primary use of this app but I would love the ability to see elevation gain/loss totals and graphs. I'd also love the ability to rename tracks. Maybe I'll contribute.
I use this app whenever I remember to turn it on. Great app!
Very useful. Simple and easy to use. Many thanx to the developers.
OK, very nice & light app. Thanks.
No instructions, not intuitive, how does it work? Great idea to review user instructions. I would have, but could not find a link in the menu. A help link would be real nice.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: EDIT: The v3.0 released today introduced a new and more user friendly bottom bar and added a link to the online help. Thanks for your useful suggestion!

google_play_reviews.content: A great no nonsense GPS logging app. If you want your device to record your location this is it - good interface and no setup needed.
good
Very handy, reliable accuracy, easy to export
The best app ever. I really appreciate it. It works very good üëç. The exported file (.gpx) I can use in JOSM to edit the map. You have 5 stars from me üòâ
Please Add follow track section, without map.
Just gets the job done. No fuss no unncessary bells and whistles.
Great for uploading to Google Earth Pro to make movies
Best app for track logging

Exported kml was far out of scale. Otherwise great! The GPX file export however was perfect so a nice app if you can manipulate formats. The developer has responded to this post in record time and may point out an error by me? Credit to them!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please explain in a more complete way the problem you are facing with KML files, and we'll try to help you. You can send also an email with files and images. - EDIT: thanks for your email, we hope that the answer helped to solve your issue!

google_play_reviews.content: Does exactly what it says
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can upload to Google Drive by selecting one or more tracks on the Tracklist and clicking the Share icon.

google_play_reviews.content: This has been the perfect gps logger I have used so far. It gives me all I need to capture my tracks without the bloat and complexity of rarely used features. Great job!
Great little app. Does exactly what I need, no more. If you just want to record a gps track, easily get it to another machine to process, and you want an easy user interface, this is it.
Does what it says, not a lot of useless extras.
Has continuous issue finding location when moving in vehicle. Walking track recording is satisfactory. Creates placemarks but missed tracks
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It could be caused by an aggressive power saving method. You should set it to high performance instead of maximum power Saving.

google_play_reviews.content: Dir:fig
Simple and easy ! Wonder if it will work in background on a pixel 3a with Android 11 as the Location access all the time is no longer available?update: tx for the prompt answer!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Starting from v2.3.0 the App doesn't need the "all-the-time" Location Permission on Android 10+ because the access to Location is always done by the User when the App is in Foreground. Once the location is active, the app will continue to use it in background. For this use it is sufficient to grant the "while-in-use" access Permission.

google_play_reviews.content: Brilliant, does everything I need it to. Logs tracks and allows you to set waypoints. Thank you!
Excellent app. Simple, lightweight and provides accurate tracking. Exports tracks in KML and GPX for analysis or mapping in other applications.

Almost what I need. I want something that can stay on in the background forever and simply log. I can then use the GPS data to locate my photos. What is keeping me from GPS logger is that it can not log slower than once every 3 seconds. To be on all the time, I just need to be able to enter a number here (which will be 20-30 times slower but save a lot of power).

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The new v3.0 introduced a redesigned bottom bar, strongly inspired by audio recorders, and a good number of new features; if you want give it a try!

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and easy to use to log a track or get your GPS coordinates
Very useful appsüëåüëåüëå

This app does exactly what it should do. Its perfect for anyone who just needs to record GPS data in a friendly format (i.e. text, kml, or gpx) . And, I find the developer to be responsive and helpful. Cheers!
Good App. Though some phones close it after a while. That's not the fault of the app
Very useful application, without data or wifi using only GPS. I like it very much.
awesome
I liked it v much but now I cannot access my previous gpx recordings, the app doesn't see them anymore !
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The app records the tracks in a database, that is stored into the private folder of the app.
The tracks that are listed on Tracklist are the recordings stored into this database. Your exported GPX tracks are not visible on the Tracklist.

google_play_reviews.content: The best and simple GSP logger
No way to print the route
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can view your tracks with any external GPX/KML Viewer, directly from the GPS Logger's tracklist, as written into the app description on the Store. A good Viewer for Android is GPX Viewer, or Google Earth, but there are lots of Alternatives around.

google_play_reviews.content: Basic functionality but does what it does well
This looks like exactly what I need. I can set placemarks and tracks, and can export them for my own use instead of begging for my data from someone else's database. Thank you!!!

Thank you, works as expected. Request for developers: can you implement the option to rename a track before exporting, now the truck name is the date-time value, if possible to change the name to something more meaningful. Best regards,
Nice and simple. I use it for jogging.

Really like this app, can see where I've been by importing into Memory Map. However, since latest update to 2.2.10, the gpx file does not import directly. It seems to be the statistics that it doesn't like. Now have to edit file to delete these first. Update: If the statistics comments are moved to immediately follow the earlier comments, ie one block of comments instead of two; then Memory Map is fine and loads the gpx file.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v2.3.0 solved the issue with Memory-Map. Thanks for your precious feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: it is a good app very nice.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try the new App's update and check whether the problem is solved. We would be glad to receive your kind feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: I live this appüòò

This is a great app. Only slight issue is that from v2.2.10 you've added summary info into the. gpx export that now means it won't load into my mapping software without manually editing the file. It's there a benefit of the extra info in the file? Edit: I'm using Memory Map. I noticed that the summary was commented but it still won't load. Maybe I should refer to them?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v2.3.0 solved the issue with Memory-Map. Thanks for your precious feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful when travelling to remote land where no phone signal is available and I can log my route for review at a later time. Thanks for this useful app.

Current version doesn't seem to like air travel very well. Old ver collected correctly (>3000 points) where curr ver <400 for same ~35min flight. Problem solved: Remedied rather aggressive current Android power savings settings
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately the plane body does an excellent job of blocking GPS signal. In general if you're in a window seat you will be able to get a signal by holding the GPS near the window (or, for example, on a tray table) - but if you're elsewhere on the plane it's very unlikely you'll get a signal.

google_play_reviews.content: Its has been precise everyime so far. Love the uploads to maps.

An excellent logger, easy to use. Very responsive development team. Issue with launching Google Earth fixed in v2.2.9. A minor niggle: it would be great if tracks could be re-imported, e.g. for moving to another device or reinstalling.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks of your precious Feedback and the email you sent us, the v2.2.9 fixed the problem with Earth.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, however there are a few things that would be nice to include. A way of loading coordinates in to the app as a point to navigate or log tracks too. A way to view your current position in a satellite map view while on the move. Additionally, I cannot seem to open Google Earth from the app, it just shows the loading screen.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v2.2.9 fixed the problem with Earth. Thanks for your Feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Good app. It works fine. Lightwell. Developer listen to issues and fixes them. Easily record tracks and export them to other formats. Track your distance, time, average speed...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: When the device was turned off, the app was active and it was recording a track? After the data was lost, the track number restarted from.. - EDIT: the v2.2.7 fixes this issue (see release notes); we apologise for your data loss, and we thank you for your precious feedback.

google_play_reviews.content: Seems to work well, but having to convert output to be seen on earth is real nuisance. Thank you will try that. Why can't I move it to see card? An running out of space. Ok tks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can export your tracks in KML, no conversion is needed to view them in Earth.. - EDIT: on v2.2.7 we improved the integration with the external Viewers.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app and useful.work perfectly!

Exactly what I was looking for, a simple light app that records tracks (for exercise and commute optimization purposes, in my case) and export / show them later. BUT ... I have not been able to make it record continuously, it stops recording the moment the screen turns off when I put the phone in my pocket / satchel / lunch bag, even though I have excluded from battery optimization. I am using a Pixel 2XL with Android 11 EDIT: Whoa! Fast support, thanks! I had Location access only while using the app, changed to always and it worked on my commute back. Strangely, it only recorded 30 minutes up to the trip first stop and not the final 10 minutes.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please go on Android Settings, Apps, GPS Logger, Battery and verify that the Background Activity is allowed, the Location Permission is set to "Allow all the time", and the Battery Usage is Not Optimised. EDIT: another optimisation could be still active (for example the Adaptive Battery). Unfortunately every brand implements them in a different way

google_play_reviews.content: This app provides an option to download altitude data for offline use. Which seems good. Have a simple interface too. I think, the time shown in it is not the local time, it's some GPS time I guess. Also, I wish there was an option to view the tracks recorded.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The new updates of the app introduced the visualization of the Time in the local time zone, and improved the integration with external Viewers.

google_play_reviews.content: Very simple to use
Excellent no frills GPS position data logger. Can export in various formats including overlay on maps.Me
Excellent.. Works perfectly, easy to use and accurate. Works on phone and tablet.
Garbage
Awesome! Nice smooth path plots, could use an option to only plot when moving.
So far, just trying it out, so will update to 5 stars after using it for a while.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We hope you'll enjoy this App!

google_play_reviews.content: Continue to love this app. I regularly use it in the background to compare against my cycling apps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: EDIT: You are right, the issue is caused by the GPS "Week Number" rollover of the 6th of April 2019, that is affecting some old GPS hardware. Thanks to your useful feedback and to the track you submitted via email, the new release v2.2.0 corrects the issue!

google_play_reviews.content: OPPO A5 is not able to establish connection. Kindly do optimisations for the above described set.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: GPS Logger should be compatible with your phone. Please try to reboot your device, go in an open area and repeat your test. It seems not relevant, but a system reboot is really the solution in most of these cases. We await your kind feedback! - EDIT: have you tried the reboot?

google_play_reviews.content: Very great app
Very good, simple, efficient, no clutter, not intrusive and does what you want perfectly!
used this app to track my route last summer, 14k mile motorcycle ride through 41 states. a little tricky to get phone settings just right but otherwise easy to use.
Cool App

Absolutely excellent for me so far. I've been able to log a 5 hour journey without so much as a hiccup so far. Plus many 2 hour ones. I just had to disable phones battery saving mode because obviously you don't want the phone to suspend the gps data while you are moving. Overall very happy indeed. I also love that this is open source software.

The intervals are 1,2 or 3 secondes. That doesn't makes sense but that's the way it is... Need interval of one minute? Need an interval of 5 minutes? You can't get it. Totally useless for most outdoor activities.
A simple GPS logging app that works and is easy on the battery.

Many here report erratic logging. I did not have that problem on my tablet but did with an android 10 phone. Logging would halt as soon as the GPS signal became weak, and never recover when running in sleep mode. Although the app had permission to access my location when running, it also needed permission at all times - to recover from signal loss. After granting that extra permission it now works perfectly for me. Hope this helps others.
I'm very pleased. The only thing missing is the ability to attach images to placemarks
Awesome!
Superb app.
I'm unable to use my Whatsapp
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please explain how your issue is related to GPS Logger, and we'll try to help you.

google_play_reviews.content: Works well. Takes minimal resources if you use sane settings. Generated KML+GPX files are easily importable by Google and other software. Excellent support (via GITHub).

Records well. The "view in Google earth" button goes to Earth but the track doesn't show. It will show if I manually load it via "projects" in Earth,. Edit: I will try your tip below. Excellent, the tip worked. Go to "settings", "apps", "earth", "permissions" and "storage" and set that to enabled.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please check in your Android System Settings, section Apps, that Earth has the Storage Permission granted.

google_play_reviews.content: Great tool
Good clear GPS signal and display. The time is 1hr out? Can it be set for gmt (s)?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The GPS time was always expressed in the timezone of Greenwich (UTC). By popular Demand, the v2.2.10 added the Visualization of GPS Time in the local Timezone

google_play_reviews.content: Bad
Excellent piece of work.
Best app
Easy to use app. Simple and useful.

Great at first but after 7 tracks it no longer gets a GPS signal even after 80 minutes. Tested today and it worked after rebooting phone. Also I must say I'm using the free app and the developer responded within hours. Excellent service. Thanks guys this has helped a 50 yr old get fit again, who needs a "fitbit" thing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try first to reboot your Device, go in an open Area and repeat your test. If your problem is still present, please write us an e-mail describing your problem in a more complete way, including a screenshot of the application when is trying to get the GPS signal, and we'll try to solve your issue. EDIT: Great. Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and useful. It's like to have some auto sync to a cloud.
This is one of those rare delights in an app that does what it's supposed to do very well without being a nosy pest to phone or resources. Thank you!
Is lightweight, user friendly and records tracks. It says Java error when downloading geod height file of 2028 kb. Does not download.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The Update v2.3.2 restored the download of the EGM Grid for the old Android 4.x devices

google_play_reviews.content: A simple and stable GPS logger. My phone reported high battery usage even when not recording, but on closer investigation this is not the case, it is my phone's battery management that groundlessly blames apps that are not managed by it. If not logging or being in the foreground, this app does not use power.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app keeps the GPS always active when it is in foreground, for recording and visualization purpose. Furthermore, if you are recording, the GPS is kept active also when the app is in background. Otherwise the GPS is not accessed. You can easily check the GPS status of your Android device: when active, the System status bar shows the GPS icon.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple, easy to use. It just works. Great job!!!
My go to GPS recorder as it simple and reliable. Be nice to have automatic naming when marking a waypoint and add to the main screen new track run and moving time.
Works well. Easy to use and export the tracks. The only annoying bug is that it stops recording if I take a picture with my phone, so I have a lot of incomplete tracks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately there is a known issue with camera on some Moto G devices, but we found no way to solve it by changing the GPS Logger's code (that doesn't access to camera). Maybe it is caused by something related to the memory management of these devices. You can view the open issue tracking here: https://github.com/BasicAirData/GPSLogger/issues/71

google_play_reviews.content: Simple, does what I want it to do, thanks.
Does exactly what I needed it for - records my long distance tracks and I can mark POI's. Plain and simple interface, low battery consuming. So far no complaints.

1) I installed yesterday. I have now tried 6 times to log on a trip, but after 46-47 seconds logging stops. I have tried to register on the homepage, but was prevented from doing so. 2) The response below is irrelevant. I had the settings on unlimited battery usage. Of course. And I tried to register to find a page with "HELP" or user forum. But I have tried from two computers and a tablet to register. I do not even get to entering a username, before I am blocked. (Sony Xperia, Android 10, latest update on April 1.) 3) I have tried in foreground once - no change. The rest was only in background. If you can call 46 seconds background. 4) I have allways had stamina to be activated at 25% or below. The battery level was 60-90% during my trials. 5) No, there is no message. By the way: why is it, you engage in this cumbersomme support. Instead of answering my mail or opening up your login registration. End of story from here.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: GPS Logger is free and does not require any registration. Please check that the Sony STAMINA Mode is disabled: Open your phone‚Äôs settings, Select ‚ÄúBattery‚Äù, Tap STAMINA mode, Choose ‚ÄúNever‚Äù). When you re-open the app after a background stop, does the app show a "the app has been killed in background" message?

google_play_reviews.content: Pretty basic but good app
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app could be closed by the system during the background recording. To avoid it, you have to go on the Android Settings and turn off all battery monitoring and optimizations for GPS Logger. Sadly any device brand implemented in a different way the settings to keep safe the background apps, so a little research must be done.

google_play_reviews.content: I've used many GPS apps over the years and most fall short somewhere...well not this little gem. It does what it says on the box, is easy to use delivers exactly what a tracker should. Wonderful
Great accuracy and super easy to use ... Just wish the export to google Earth worked.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v2.2.9 corrected the problem and improved the integration with Earth and other Viewers: give it a try!

google_play_reviews.content: thanks! adfree and easy to use. perfect for hiking, biking ...
Simple. Meets my needs without excess bloat.
Does exactly what I need, no more and no less. Simple, fast, no accounts, no ads, easy to export data.
This app provides me reliable trackings while running or cycling on trails mostly in forest areas.
Looking forward to test-driving the app. Reading through recent review comments, how/where on an Android 9 do I set Earth as the default viewer for KML?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The v2.2.9 improved the integration with Viewers, by adding a new Selector and Preference for external GPX/KML Viewer. No more digging into System Default Apps!

google_play_reviews.content: Good
Great app. Small and fast. Does everything it is supposed to do perfectly.
works well in background of waze
NEC Good

***Samsung Owner Warning: this app doesn't work unless your power save settings are set to 'High Performance'*** This app is easily the best lightweight gps logger I've used. Unfortunately, it seems that several distributions of android (looking at you, Samsung) ignore battery optimization settings and restrict its ability to work when the display is locked, rendering it nearly useless for screen-off tracking unless you max out your power settings and just use a battery bank.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please go on the Android Settings, section Apps, and turn off all Battery Monitoring and Optimizations for GPS Logger. Check also that the Application is NOT Background Restricted. EDIT: Thanks for sharing your experience with us and with other users!

google_play_reviews.content: The best free gps and tracker ever used.
Very good. Useful application.
Works just as described. Depending on your phone, you could deplete the battery in five or so hours. For longer trips, carry a spare battery or an inexpensive power pack.
GPS logger is consistent and reliable.
Choice app when I knew how to work it. Still learning how to tag photos etc how the app claims and marking spots or editing it?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can geotag your Photos, for example, using the GPX track with ExifTool (https://exiftool.org/geotag.html), Lightroom, RAWTherapee, Darktable or another photo editor that support the GPX-based geotagging feature.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app
couldn't fine gps..."looking for gps"
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try to reboot your device. Check also that the GPS signal is strong enough and, if not, go in an open area and repeat your test. If you want, give us another chance!

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent way to geotag photos. My DSLR doesn't have GPS, however running GPS logger and exporting the gpx file makes geotagging the photos simple using exiftool. Brilliant app!
Very nice,very accurate works really good with maps.me... one thing that could be nice if the trackpoints have time stamps with the speed at that point for when i drive company car.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Trackpoints and Placemarks are saved with Timestamp and current Speed. You can have both data by exporting your track in GPX v1.0 or in TXT. In fact the KML standard doesn't support timestamps and speeds, and GPX v1.1 doesn't support speeds.

google_play_reviews.content: Superb "ultralight" GPX logger. If you want to have maps at the same time I recommend Oruxmaps. But if all you need is a logger this one is great!
Great app. Does what it says well.
Man, the accuracy is superb and no internet connection required. This is unbelievably useful for recording the route even when our phone is offline.
Works great and doesn't drain tbe battery
Great app. Very accurate and express the routes in multiple formats
Did what I needed. Hope to see better features like auto upload to cloud or Google drive
Accuracy is substandard .
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The Accuracy depends on your phone's GPS chip and on the environment. We suggest to check your test area, as there can be inaccuracy due to trees, buildings, clouds, etc. If you are curious to deepen the argument, you can find an interesting Technical Document here: http://graticules.blogspot.com/2017/04/using-gps-logger-android-app-for-field.html

google_play_reviews.content: This is the best logger I found in the store. It is simple and effective.
Open source, highly accurate. How possible might it be to add an optional way point menu item that records a photo or video or audio with GPS location?!
Useful GPS logger.
Excellent app. All of the important controls in a friendly interface. Follows default file formats (e.g. no time data in kml files). Better than most, including the most popular app.
Good basic GPS logger. Does what i want, except that it labels all my bike rides with a car symbol :)

Edited: Overall experience has been excellent. Love the ability to pause the recording of a track and to add placemarks. I am presently using four different GPS apps simultaneously. File sizes are moderate compared to other apps. Good performance. - previously reported problem with track export was caused by the phone, not this application.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The exporting process needs time because the tracks are created on-the-fly when you export them. This way you can export your tracks with different settings. The exporter is highly optimized: it should process at least 1000 pts/s (KML + GPX). If this value is much smaller for you, please contact us and write us your performances!

google_play_reviews.content: Nice adaptation of open source, but it only records the track. A different app is needed to view the track, and I need to see it in real time. Seeing my photos on the map is fun, too. Can't do that with this app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can find the detailed features list of this app on the description of the app store. If you want an app with an integrated viewer for tracks and photos, you have to find another app on the store. Read carefully each features list, in order to find the best app for you!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The placemarks are exported into KML, GPX and TXT files. For now you can only view the track card that shows the amount of placemarks. The in-app details screen is an incoming feature, on the current app release it is not yet possible to view/modify the list of placemarks of a track.

Great simple GPS logger. The settings are simple and functional without being complicated. You can download KML Viewer to instantly view saved KML tracks and points from within GPS Logger.

Love the app. Like the description says, its battery use is minimal. I tried 3 other apps and they all used more battery. My only request would be a way to pause recording the tracks. Would highly recommend it for a simple, effecient GPS track logger.
really nice

google_play_reviews.content: Great for creating survey route maps.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Not directly, but you can easily save the GPX tracks on your PC, and then upload them to OSM editor with a simple Drag&Drop. There are several ways to export a track to the PC: EXPORT it (the track is saved to /GPSLogger folder of your Android device) and then copy the file to the PC using a USB cable; SHARE via Dropbox, Google Drive, FTP, E-mail..

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and easy to use, it does a good job tracking distance start to end but not between placemarks.

A great simple app that does just what it says it will do
The best app for rode mape

In case please enable it and verify whether your problem is solved. If not, please describe your problem in a more complete way and we'll try to help you!

google_play_reviews.content: it's great
Excellent - I use GPS Logger all the time, and it always works perfectly. Plus, it's open source. A huge "thank you" to the developer. A+++

Good
Simple and to the point. Love it.
It is verry useful for site engineers
Simple apps with specific function to records tracks using gps, and it works. No nonsense or other unuseful function, the interface is simple and clean too.

The app works as promised, and the track and statistics computed are accurate from what I can tell.  The app can save tracks as GPX or KML files and upload them to shared spaces like Google Drive.  That is the good part.  But the interface is ugly, and the controls are unintuitive:  there is no single button to start/pause a track, instead you have to start a track by hitting "Trackpoints", and then you have to finish recording by hitting a tickmark somewhere else on the screen - not once, but twice!  There is no map inside the app, so you can't track your progress on a real map.  I could not get a saved track to show up in google earth on my device either.  Also, the KML file produced could not be loaded into google maps - produced an error about file being too long.  Probably some missing end tag or something like that.  Fortunately, the GPX file could be read by google maps and produced a good track on the map.  I am keeping it for now because it is open-source and ad-free, and serves its basic purpose.  But there is lots of room for improvement.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We would be glad to receive the KML file that has the problem with Google Maps, in order to verify if the file is really too long or if some tags are missed. Thanks in advance!

google_play_reviews.content: Will not let you export data. You can only delete. Not sure if there is a pay version to do that. They say it's free
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It is 100% Open and Free Software! Furthermore, during this years we improved the App adding a better integration with external Viewers, many configuration checks with a special care to Background recording, a multi-selection Tracklist and much more. If you want, give us another chance!

google_play_reviews.content: Compact, easy to read screens and use. Great app

Excellent gps record . Used to geotag photos from a non-gps camera and to

This app is amazing! I snagged it for grabbing stats while riding my 
motorcycle on a track, and it performed flawlessly! Gave me the exact bits

the track data. Whoever thought to include that is a genius.
Not working on my g800f
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is a cool "Getting Started" guide (http://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/getting-started-guide-for-gps-logger/) where you can learn the basic usage and explore all the settings of the app. There is a F.A.Q. section too. If you want, give us another chance!

google_play_reviews.content: dont work in redmi5
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please go on Location section of your Android settings: maybe the phone is set to use the "Battery saving" Locating method. This method uses Wi-Fi & mobile networks to estimate your location, without turn on the GPS. In case please switch to "Phone only" or "High accuracy" method to enable the GPS sensor too. In any case, please give us a feedback!

google_play_reviews.content:
Simple, free, small, kind on battery power. If you want a light track 
recorder, that's it.

Black screens outdoors are a nightmare for users with glasses, reflections 
make it difficult especially with red writing, a light version would be 
good.
Working prefectly..
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is a cool "Getting Started" guide (http://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/getting-started-guide-for-gps-logger/) where you can learn the basic usage and explore all the settings of the app. There is a F.A.Q. section too. If you want, give us another chance!

google_play_reviews.content: Works well for me.

Works as expected on my device now, but seems to have problems with 
difficult GPS conditions.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is a cool "Getting Started" guide (http://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/getting-started-guide-for-gps-logger/) where you can learn the basic usage and explore all the settings of the app. If you want, give us another chance!

google_play_reviews.content:
This is the simple and lightweight gps app it promise to be. T But the gps 
record is not very accurate in city and the record often ends on its own.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app could be closed by the system during the background recording. To avoid it, you can go on the device maintenance section of your android settings, select the battery sub-section, and add GPS Logger to the list of unmonitored apps

google_play_reviews.content: Useful

Gave me the precise location and altitude that I was looking for so it's a 
win-win

Looks like a well made functional app but first use fails to impress. I 
tested on trip to work today. Set home marker and set out on an hiur long 
trip with errands and a fuel stop ending at work where I set a marker and 
saved everything. I then chose "view in google earth". All I've got to see 
on the map are the two markers with no trail in between.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: GPS Logger might be set to show the tracks in 3D, and the track may be hidden under the terrain. Please go in GPSLogger Exportation settings, switch the Altitude Mode to "Projected to ground" and try again. In case please send us your track: we'll help you to resolve your problem

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful.

Great GPS logger, works flawlessly and uses little battery. All in all a 
great app.

It is not clear where tracks are saved and it doesn't offer place to store 
them. Not possible to rename or add comments to tracks. But it seems to 
record quite well.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Each recorded point is immediately stored into a private local Database, in order to avoid any loss of data. We don't store your data in any cloud or webspace. You can anytime export a track using the EXPORT (the track is exported in the /GPSLogger folder of your device) or the SHARE (in this case you can choose where to save it) feature.

google_play_reviews.content:
Only just downloaded the app and already like it! The only thing that would 
make it better is if you could add an option to save the time as UTC 
timestamp for the txt export, that would be great! :)
Easy and useful...
Very good but takes time to track
This app doesn't work in mi phone
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try the new App's update and check whether the problem is solved. We would be glad to receive your kind feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Amazingly Simple App. Wish I could donate.
Looked for something to track my walking, exercise. Lots of info.
Doesn't find GPS on Xiaomi phone. Come on.... üòë
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try the new App's update and check whether the problem is solved. We would be glad to receive your kind feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Thanks for your reply. Got Google earth working by giving storage permission but export feature still not working.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The Export feature saves the selected track in the /GPSLogger folder of your android device. You can connect your phone to your computer via USB and use the file manager to view, manage, and download the exported tracks. Please check if the folder exists and it contains your exported files!

google_play_reviews.content: This app could not get gps signal on my phone. It worked in my previous phone of the same maker. I tried with different app, and that app works just fine. Please solve this issue as I had good experience with this app. UPDATE: In lieu of your reply, I have tried reinstall both with and without phone restart. No Luck.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please try the v.2.1.12 and check whether the problem is solved. We would be glad to receive your kind feedback.

google_play_reviews.content: Smart, simple and light-weighted. Well done!
Perfectly Simple and Always Accurate

Working good! I have a question about the 'accuracy' column, though. The 
recorded data on that column is HDOP?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: No, the column is the horizontal accuracy expressed in meters

google_play_reviews.content: Great lightweight app, but I can't see how to change to storage to my SD card. Is there a way to do this?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: No, it is not possible to change the folder yet, maybe this option will be added in future updates

google_play_reviews.content: Good, lightweight app.  Crashes on occasion, so some tracking lost and not 100% reliable, but great for what it is, and by occasion, I mean twice in two weeks of constant use.  Just does the basics, without trying to reinvent the wheel.
Intuitive interface and low battery usage make this a five-star app.

Max speed 8 km/h in a track is shown incorrectly higher than other GPX file viewers which reported that the highest speed is just 7.1 or 7.2 only. When Track stat based on Moving time is chosen, exported GPX produced mismatched Duration.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: 1) The GPX viewers often apply a slight data filtering in order to show smoother graphs, but introducing little differences in statistics. It's possible to do a verification by opening the GPX file with a text editor and finding the max recorded speed. 2) The duration of tracks is not exported in GPX files; this information is calculated by viewers

google_play_reviews.content: The GPX output is consistent with those of a Garmin watch and the Strava app.
Beware. Maps.me COPIES the track to its own folder. After deleting tracks in gps-logger they will remain in maps.me.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We would be grateful to receive the track that caused the inconvenience, in order to check that the the app has correctly exported the track. We suggest you to consider the possibility of a Maps.me bug, and send the track to them too. We had positive feedback about the use of GPS Logger with Maps.me. In any case, we are sorry for the inconvenience!

google_play_reviews.content: I like this app but can you please add auto extract feature to it in a given interval (replacing the old file for an ongoing track)? I use it to auto backup my tracks to google drive. Auto backup to google drive would also be a cool feature.
Good for travel tracking.
Best app.

The best GPS tracker ever! Work extremely well even with a very low-end device like Motorola Moto C which has no magnetometer sensor. No internet needed either. The recorded track then can be directly viewed on Maps.Me, an app that also works fully offline.  Love this app and many thanks to the developer!
Excellent GPS logger! Simple, clear, effective, free, open source, no ads, no unnecessary permissions. Thank you so much.
Excellent app to datalog speed. Tried so many others without success. Simple user friendly interface.

Just started using it and I like it, but I think I spotted one bug. In the exported GPX file recorded speeds are about 4 times less then the real speeds. Average and max speed shown in the track list seem ok.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The speeds in GPX files must be saved in meters per second (as required by the GPX standard). Hence, if your app is set to show speeds in km/h, the speeds shown in tracklist will differ by a 3.6 factor, because of the conversion between units of measurement. Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Great app for my needs.  I would not trust it on my current phone for detailed tracking, but it works well for vehicle tracking.
Very good app, but sometimes it stops recording in background. Can you solve this problem
The app works nice, except altitude gap which gives unreasonable values. I enjoy using it on  my bike rides.
SUGGESTION TO DEVELOPERS: It would be much better if allowed live upload via URL.
Very nicely done, has all the features I wanted and is very easy and intuitive. Total climb and descent would be a handy feature on the track view.
It's OK, but it would be nice if it could be configured to start tracking as soon as the app was started.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
It's possible to start recording when app starts, by toggle the "trackpoints" button, also if the first fix is not yet been obtained.  
Therefore it's preferrable to wait the gps fix and then wait again (approx one minute) to allow the full stabilization of the signal, avoiding to record the initial stabilization phase. Thanks for your feedback!

google_play_reviews.content: Great tool for track logging. Simply writes tracks, export in kml and gpx, saves power in background. Can run for hours not killing the battery. Love it.
Great app that does exactly what supposed to do, although I can't get it to work on Google earth.  I must be missing something. Can anyone explain how that works
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Try this procedure. Save one GPS track. Go to the tracklist and hold down your finger on the track thumbnail. A menu will pop up, select view in and then select G. Earth application.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice app, simple and does just what it says it will do, and free, and no ads!
